overview.title: Components Overview
overview.description: DevUI provides rich basic UI components for web applications. We will continue to explore the best UI practices of enterprise-level applications. Welcome to DevUI.

accordion.name: Accordion
accordion.tmw: Accordion is used when you need to set a menu list navigation.

basicDemo.title: Basic Usage
basicDemo.description: Transfer a menu to listen to the open/close event (menuToggle) or click event (itemClick) of an expandable menu that contains sub-items. By default, the open attribute is used for expandable menus, the active attribute is used for clicking menus, and the disabled attribute is used for disabled items. Set restrictOneOpen to specify whether to display only one level-1 menu.
Only one level-1 menu can be expanded.

multiLevelDemo.title: Composite Hierarchy and Auto Expand
multiLevelDemo.description: Multiple levels and no restriction on nesting levels are supported. You can use autoOpenActiveMenu independently to automatically expand the parent level of an activated menu.

templateDemo.title: Using a Template
templateDemo.description: Expandable menus and clickable menus use different templates. You can expand the menuItemTemplate or click the menu to specify an itemTemplate. No contentTemplate is specified for the data template. You can run the showNoContent command to control whether to expand the content when there is no data. The loadingTemplate parameter is specified in the loading template. The value of loadingKey of an item controls whether to display the loading status.
templateDemo.The expandable menu node must have a non: The expandable menu node must have a non-undefined child.

animations.name: Animations
animations.description: DevUI provides smooth, efficient, and simple animations for typical web interaction scenarios to improve user interaction experience.
animations.tmw: 1. The appearance or disappearance of elements; 2. The element status changes.

collapsedDemo.title: Expand Collapse
collapsedDemo.description: Used for expand and collapse of elements on a page. It is represented by uniaxial change of the container size. It is often used for components such as accordion, tree, and panel.

fadeInOutDemo.title: Fade In Out
fadeInOutDemo.description: Used for elements appear or disappear that are stacked on a page and have hosts , It is represented by the transparency change of the content area and uniaxial change of the container size. It is often used for components such as dropDown, select and datePicker.

flyInOutDemo.title: Fly In Out
flyInOutDemo.description: Used for elements stacked on the page and covering the entire page appear and disappear, It is represented by the transparency change of the content area and displacement of the content area, It is often used for components such as drawer

wipeInOutDemo.title: Wipe In Out
wipeInOutDemo.description: Used for elements that are stacked on the page but not at the page edge appear or disappear, It is represented by the transparency change of the content area and slight displacement of the content area based on the y-axis. It is often used for components such as modal

avatar.name: Avatar
avatar.tmw: When users want to display their own profile avatar.

basicDemo.title: Basic Rules
basicDemo.description: When the profile picture gadget transfers the name attribute, the profile picture field is displayed based on certain rules. For details, please see API.
basicDemo.cnStart: If the value starts with Chinese, the last two characters are used.
basicDemo.enStart: If the value starts with English, the first two characters are used.
basicDemo.multi: If there are multiple English names, use the first two letters of the name.
basicDemo.others: If the value does not start with Chinese or English, the first two characters are used.

configDemo.title: Basic Configuration
configDemo.description: The width, height, and whether the avatar is a circular can be set. In addition, the display fields of the avatar can be customized, and the customized image can be transferred.
configDemo.smaller: Sets the width. If the height is less than 30px, only one character is displayed.

specialDemo.title: Special Display
specialDemo.description: The avatar component processes some special situations, for example, the user does not exist or the default avatar is displayed. For details, please see API.
specialDemo.notExist: If name, customText, and imgSrc are not transferred, the user who uses the avatar does not exist.
specialDemo.beNull: If the values of name, customText, and imgSrc are empty, the user who uses the avatar does not have a nickname and the default avatar is used.

ImagePreview.name: ImagePreview
ImagePreview.tmw: Preview images or images in containers based on user input.

basicDemo.description: Run the image-preview command to preview images in the container.

customDemo.title: Customizing the preview window
customDemo.description: Transfer subject to enable preview when next is triggered.

zIndexDemo.description1: Set zIndex to control the level of the pop-up effect.Set backDropZIndex to control the level of the back drop effect of the pop-up.
zIndexDemo.description2: When zIndex is set to a value smaller than backDropZIndex, imagePreview is displayed below the back drop.
zIndexDemo.description3: You can disable imagePreview by Esc.

breadcrumb.name: Breadcrumb
breadcrumb.description: Show the current hierarchy of pages.
breadcrumb.tmw:
1. When users want to know the current hierarchy.
2. When Users want to quickly return to the previous page.
3. When users want to navigate to any page at the same level.

back-top.name: BackTop
back-top.description: A button for returning to the top of the page.
back-top.tmw: When the page is too long, and the user wants to frequently return to the top to view related content.

basicDemo.title: Basic Usage
basicDemo.description: Returns to the default style of the top button, 50px from the bottom, 30px on the right.
basicDemo.text: After the function is enabled, slide down the scroll bar to view the default button on the top.

customizeDemo.title: Customize
customizeDemo.description: You can customize the button style for the backTop. The width and height are limited to 40 px * 40 px. In addition, you can set the scrolling height of the button by setting visibleHeight.
customizeDemo.customizeStyle: Customize the style of the back to top button. The width and height are limited to 40px * 40px.
customizeDemo.text: Enable the switch and slide down the scroll bar to display the button.
customizeDemo.scrollHeight: When the scrolling height reaches the value of visibleHeight, the button is displayed to the top.

scrollDemo.title: Scrolling Container
scrollDemo.description: You can set the scrollTarget parameter to return to the top of a specified container.

button.name: Button
button.description: The button is used to start an instant operation.
button.tmw: When users want to mark or encapsulate a group of operation commands that respond to user clicks, and trigger the corresponding logic.

button-primary-and-common.title: Combinations of Primary & Common Buttons
button-primary-and-common.description: When the primary and the common is used at the same time, a scene usually has only one primary button.

button-danger.title: Danger Buttons
button-danger.description: Indicates key operations in the system, such as delete scenarios.

button-auto-focus.title: Auto-focus Buttons
button-auto-focus.description: The autofocus button is used to automatically obtain the focus.

button-icon.title: Icon Buttons

button-size.title: Button Size
button-size.description: There are four sizes of buttons. You can select a proper size based on the service scenario.

button-groups.title: Button Group
button-groups.description: Put multiple buttons as a group into the button group container. The size of the button group can be set by size and mixed with the drop-down menu.
button-groups.text: The button group has four sizes. You can set the size of all elements by setting the size.

badge.name: Badge
badge.description: Round logo of number in the upper right corner of the icon.
badge.tmw: The badge is appeared at the upper right corner of the icon or the right of a list item. It's usually an icon that shows a message with a number to tell user what need to be handled.

basicDemo.title: Basic Badge
basicDemo.description: Basic badge type. When there is a package element, the badge and number are displayed in the upper right corner.
basicDemo.basic: Standard badge. The count parameter specifies the number of badges to be displayed. The status parameter specifies the status color of the badge.
basicDemo.maxCount: The maxCount parameter is used to set the maximum number of badges to be displayed. The default value is 99.
basicDemo.statusColor: The bgColor parameter is used to set the status color of the badge. The offset parameter is used to set the badge offset.
basicDemo.position: Set position to set the badge position.

dotDemo.title: Dotted Badge
dotDemo.description: Point badge type. When there is a package element and showDot is set to true, the dot is displayed in the upper right corner by default.

countDemo.title: Count Badge
countDemo.description: When the badge is used independently and does not enclose any elements, only the badge status color and number are displayed.
countDemo.customFontColor: Customizing text and background colors using textColor and bgColor

statusDemo.title: Status Badge
statusDemo.description: When the badge is used independently, does not contain any elements, and the showDot parameter is set to true, the badge is a status badge. Different color dots are displayed for different statuses.

positionDemo.title: Badge Position
positionDemo.description: Set position to set the badge position.

customDemo.title: Custom
customDemo.description: The bgColor parameter is used to set the badge status color (the badge status color specified by status is invalid). The offset parameter is used to set the badge offset relative to the position.Customizing text and background colors using textColor and bgColor.

animation.devui-animation-duration-slow: dynamic effect duration parameter, which is usually used in scenarios such as large elements disappear and status changes.
animation.devui-animation-duration-base: dynamic effect duration parameter, which is usually used in scenarios such as the disappearance of common elements and the status change.

animation.devui-animation-ease-out: Element entry dynamic effect curve, which is usually used in the scenario where an element appears.

animation.devui-animation-linear: Linear dynamic effect curve, usually used in the scenario where the background mask layer disappears.

ZIndexDemo.description4: 4. If a mask exists, the mask is based on the corresponding z-index value -1.
ZIndexDemo.description5: 5. Content layer. Set zIndex as required. The value of zIndex must be smaller than that of the temporary layer.
ZIndexDemo.description6: 6. Background layer. Set zIndex as required. The value of zIndex must be smaller than that of the content layer.
ZIndexDemo.description7: According to the interaction mode, the content layer is classified into the background layer, content layer, and temporary layer. The sequence of the layers is as follows: Temporary layer > Content layer > Background layer. The sequence cannot be changed.
ZIndexDemo.description8: Temporary layer related to an operation or task. Generally, it carries tasks that need to be temporarily processed or feedback that needs to be received. It is higher than the content layer.
ZIndexDemo.description9: There are two modes: one is that the content area cannot be operated and is disabled by the mask mask. The user must focus on the content of the pop-up window to continue other operations (pop-up window and modal drawer). The other is that the content area can be operated without a mask. (modeless drawer, lightweight pop-up window, floating menu, user guide)
ZIndexDemo.description10: Mainly carries page elements such as page information, components, and accordion.
ZIndexDemo.description11: The page background layer is always placed at the bottom of the page. The color of the page background layer is #EEF0F5, which is neutral and soft to highlight and focus the content layer.

datatable.name: DataTable
datatable.tmw:
1. When a large amount of structured data need to be displayed.
2. When complex operations such as data sorting, filtering, and customization are required.

basicDemo.title: Basic Usage
basicDemo.description:
Simple table, displaying list data
Two implementation modes are supported. Method 1 is implemented by customizing the head and body templates and the rows and cells in the templates. Method 2 is implemented by configuring columns.

asyncDemo.title: Asynchronously loading data, configuration columns, and empty data templates
asyncDemo.description: Simulates asynchronous data loading, supports dynamic column configuration, and uses #noResultTemplateRef to configure an empty data template.

cellMergeDemo.title: Cell Merge
cellMergeDemo.description: You can use properties such as colspan and rowspan to set cell combination. You can only customize the head and body templates and the rows and cells in the templates.

checkOptionsDemo.title: Customizing Table Selection
checkOptionsDemo.description:
You can set checkOptions to configure the drop-down list box and the operations to be performed in the table header.
Two implementation modes are supported. Method 1 is implemented by customizing the head line, and method 2 is implemented by configuring columns.

dragColumnDemo.title: Column dragging
dragColumnDemo.description: This field is a low-frequency operation and is not displayed by default. When you move the cursor to the table header, a flag is displayed, allowing users to quickly sort columns.

dragRowDemo.title: Row dragging
dragRowDemo.description: The DragDrop component can be used to drag rows in a table. You can only customize the head and body templates and the rows and cells in the templates.

batchDragRowDemo.title: Batch Row dragging
batchDragRowDemo.description: You can use the DragDrop component to drag rows in a table in batches. You can press Ctrl and select multiple rows and cells to drag them. You can only customize the head and body templates and the rows and cells in the templates.

editableDemo.title: Edit Cell
editableDemo.description: Two implementation modes are supported. Method 1 is implemented by customizing cells in the body template. Method 2 is implemented by configuring columns.

expandRowDemo.title: Extended Row
expandRowDemo.description: Two implementation modes are supported. Method 1 is implemented by customizing rows in the body template. Method 2 is implemented by defining tables by configuring columns and configuring input and row data.

fixColumnDemo.title: fixed column
fixColumnDemo.description:
If there are too many columns in a table, fixed columns facilitate data location and comparison when you swipe left or right on the screen. You can set fixedLeft and fixedRight to specify the columns.
Two implementation modes are supported. Method 1 is implemented by customizing the head and body templates and the rows and cells in the templates. Method 2 is implemented by configuring columns.

fixHeightVirtualScrollDemo.title: Table Header Fixed Virtual Scroll
fixHeightVirtualScrollDemo.description: Use fixHeader to set the table header fixed and enable virtual scrolling. The height is adaptive.

headerGroupingDemo.title: Header Group
headerGroupingDemo.description: Two implementation modes are supported. Method 1 is implemented by customizing colspan and rowspan of th in the head template. Method 2 is implemented by configuring advancedHeader of column.

interactionDemo.title: Table interaction
interactionDemo.description:
Supports column sorting, column filtering, customized filtering template, selection, and column width adjustment.
Two implementation modes are supported. Method 1 is implemented by customizing the head and body templates and the rows and cells in the templates. Method 2 is implemented by configuring columns.

memoryDemo.title: Table column width memory
memoryDemo.description: The column width is memorized through the cache. After the refresh, the column width remains unchanged.

lazyDemo.title: lazy loading
lazyDemo.description: Use lazy to enable lazy loading. When the bottom of a table is scrolled, the loadMore event is triggered to implement lazy loading.

maxHeightDemo.title: Table Header Fixed
maxHeightDemo.description: Use fixHeader to set the table header to be fixed so that the table header does not follow the scrolling process.

mutiDragRowDemo.title: Batch line dragging
mutiDragRowDemo.description: You can use the DragDrop component to drag rows in a table in batches. You can press Ctrl and select multiple rows and cells to drag them. You can only customize the head and body templates and the rows and cells in the templates.

virtualScrollTreeTableBasicDemo.title: Tree table with a large amount of data Basic
virtualScrollTreeTableBasicDemo.description: To display 10,000 to 100,000 tree data records, use this table to ensure smooth operations.

virtualScrollTreeTableOperationDemo.title: Tree table with a large amount of data Operation
virtualScrollTreeTableOperationDemo.description: Basic operations, including adding, modifying, deleting, querying, copying, and cutting tree tables with a large amount of data.

virtualScrollTreeTableInteractionDemo.title: Tree table with a large amount of data Interaction
virtualScrollTreeTableInteractionDemo.description: Advanced operations on tree tables with a large amount of data, including dragging, selecting, deleting, and inheriting most functions of the original table.

virtualScrollTreeTableMultiDragDemo.title: Draging Big Data Tree Tables in Batches
virtualScrollTreeTableMultiDragDemo.description: Hold down Ctrl to select and drag rows in batches.

treeTableDemo.title: Tree table
treeTableDemo.description:
Configure the rendering tree table based on the nestedColumn attribute and the child and $isChildTableOpen fields of row data.
Two implementation modes are supported. Method 1 is implemented by customizing the head and body templates and the rows and cells in the templates. Method 2 is implemented by configuring columns.

virtualScrollDemo.title: Virtual scrolling
virtualScrollDemo.description:
Use virtualScroll to enable virtual scrolling. The row height must be fixed and the same. If the row height is higher than the default 40px, virtualItemSize must be configured.
If there is no data in the initial state, set the height of the element whose class is `cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport`, and set the position of the `d-data-table` element and noResult template.

templateValidateDemo.title: Template driven form validation
templateValidateDemo.description: To bind ngModel, ngGroupModel, and ngForm elements to the template, you can use dValidateRules to configure validation rules.

innerValidatorDemo.title: Verify a single element, use the built-in validator, and configure error message
innerValidatorDemo.subtitle: We have some integrated validators, you can go to API for more information.
innerValidatorDemo.description:
Currently, DevUI supports the following built-in validators: required, minlength, maxlength, min, max, requiredTrue, email, pattern, and whitespace.

If the user input cannot contain only spaces, use whitespacebuilt-in validator

If the user input length needs to be restricted, it is a good idea to set the maximum limit to the actual verification value +1. In addition to pattern, other built-in validators also provide built-in error messages. If you do not customize a message, the default message is used. The value of

message can be in the following formats: stringobject. (The internationalization string can be configured, for example, 'zh-cn'. The default value is 'default').

customerValidatorDemo.title: Verify a single element and customize a validator
customerValidatorDemo.description:
• A validator requires a unique id identifier. You can explicitly declare this id or declare a key that does not conflict with the reserved word, the key is identified as id, and value functions as a validator.
  • customized validator. You can return true | false to indicate whether the current validation is successful or return string | null to indicate whether the current validation is successful and return an error message. This method applies to dynamic error prompts.
  • If the validator is an asynchronous validator, you need to return your value as an Observable object. More, DevUI is compatible with the native angular validator. You can set isNgValidator to true.

customErrorStrategyDemo.title: Verify a single element. The update policy errorStrategy is incorrectly configured and the validation moment updateOn is incorrectly configured.
customErrorStrategyDemo.description:
• Specifies whether to display an error message if the verification of the errorStrategy element fails during initialization. The default value is dirty. If you want to display an error during initialization, set this parameter to prisine.
  • errorStrategy can be inherited.
  • Set updateOn to specify the verification moment. The validator updateOn is set based on the updateOn of the bound model. You can specify the validator by using ngModelOptions in the template. The default value is change, the options are as follows: blur and submit. If submit is set, validation is triggered when the form where the element is located is submitted.

customMessageShowDemo.title: Verify a single element and customize management message prompts
customMessageShowDemo.description:
• Set messageShowType to select the message automatic prompt mode. The default value is popover.
  • If popover is set to popover, error information will be displayed as popover when the element is focused. If
    • is set to text, error information is automatically displayed under the element in text mode (used with the form control container). If is set to none, error information is not automatically displayed in the view, you can obtain message from the template, or obtain the error message by listening to the messageChange event, or directly obtain the error message from the template by reference.
  • This configuration can be inherited. The
  • can customize the pop-up direction when the message prompt mode is set to popover. The default value is ['right','bottom'].
  • This configuration can be inherited.

debounceTimeDemo.title: Verify a single element and customize asyncDebounceTime
debounceTimeDemo.description:
• The default value of 300ms debounce time is provided for the asynchronous validator.
  • You can also set asyncDebounceTime in dValidateRules.
    • If your synchronization validator also needs debounce time, the verification is asynchronous and you can convert it to an asynchronous validator.
  • This configuration can be inherited.

validateTemplateForm.title: Form Validation and Submission
validateTemplateForm.description:
• dValidateRules can also be used on the ngForm and ngModelGroup elements that have been bound to the elements to manage form status and error messages in a unified manner.
  • For non-frame elements, you are advised to set dHasFeedback to true in the d-form-item container to provide error feedback.
  • For dForm, the dFormSubmit and dFormReset instructions can be used to associate elements that will trigger the commit and reset operations.
  • If asynchronous validation is set for the form, the loading button can be associated with the pending status of the form.

userRegisterDemo.title: Form verification and submission, user registration scenario
userRegisterDemo.description:
• For complex validation rules in form scenarios, it is recommended that you organize them in the controller to better organize and reuse your validation rules.
  • For automatic error prompt mode, it is recommended that you set messageShowType in dForm.
  • For the submission event triggered by dFormSubmit, you can bind dSubmit to the dForm layer, you can obtain the current form validation status and the corresponding directive reference.
  • If the form is not in the visual center when it is submitted, you can use a prompt to guide the user visually. For the prompt when the form is submitted, it is recommended that d-toast be displayed.

validateReactiveDemo.title: Reactive form validation
validateReactiveDemo.description:
Bind formGroup, formControlName, and formControl to the template and use dValidateRules to configure validation rules.

Recommended reading [Angular reactive form]

customStatusDemo.title: Feedback status of a specified form
customStatusDemo.description: You can manually specify the feedback status by setting feedbackStatus for d-form-control. Currently, the following statuses are supported: success, error, and pending.

validateSyncDemo.title: Form collaboration verification
validateSyncDemo.description: In some scenarios, your multiple form components depend on each other, joint verification (for example, password input and confirmation in registration scenarios) is required. In this case, you need to use the collaborative verification instruction dValidateSyncKey to specify the same keydValidateSyncKey instruction for the components that require system verification to support template-driven forms and reactive forms, the following example uses a template-driven form as an example: password and confirmPassword are set to the same value of dValidateSyncKey. When the value of one component changes, the other component also verifies the value.

validateCrossComponentDemo.title: Cross-component verification
validateCrossComponentDemo.description:
• Current Angular By default, Form does not support cross-component form verification status sharing. For response forms, you can use model to centrally manage and transparently transmit components.
  • For template-driven forms, you can inject the required ngModelGroup or NgForm container by using container injection during subcomponent declaration, for form elements in the template to automatically obtain the parent container.

drawer.name: Drawer
drawer.description: The floating layer panel that slides out from the screen edge.
drawer.tmw:
1. The drawer slides in from the edge of the parent window to cover part of the parent window, and you don't have to leave the current task. After the operations are complete, you can smoothly return to the original task.
2. When an additional panel is required to control the content of the parent form, the panel is called out when needed. For example, you can control the display style of the page and add content to the page.
3. Create or preview additional content when you need to insert a temporary task into the current task flow. For example, display agreement terms and create child objects.

basicDemo.description: Responsive breakpoints correspond to (px): ss > 0, ms >= 360, mm >= 768, ml >= 1024, xs >= 1280, sm >= 1440, md >= 1600, lg >= 1760, xl >= 1920. When combining settings, ss breakpoints represent common settings.

gantt.name: Gantt
gantt.tmw: When user want to use a bar-shaped chart to display the internal relationship of project, progress, and other time-related system progress over time.

basicDemo.title: Basic Usage
basicDemo.description1: The d-gantt-scale container functions as the location parent element of the time axis. The position or table, td, th, and body elements must be set.
basicDemo.description2: The widths of the d-gantt-scale and d-gantt-bar containers must be calculated based on the start time and end time using the method provided by GanttService. After initialization, the ganttScaleConfigChange dynamic settings must be subscribed.
basicDemo.description3: The time bar move and resize events change the start and end time of the time bar and the start and end time of the time axis. The time bar resize, move, and ganttScaleConfigChange events are subscribed to to to record the change.
basicDemo.description4: Respond to the move and resize events of the time bar to adjust the scrolling of the outermost container for better experience.

polyfill.name: Polyfills
polyfill.tmw: To solve the method that is not supported by the browser of an earlier version.

basicDemo.title: Usage
basicDemo.description: Currently, there are few implementation methods and are mainly used by the rich text component. Therefore, the putty script file is stored in the rich text module. You can insert the following information into src/polyfills.ts: import' ng-devui/add-ons/editorx/polyfill '; The putty script is only a piece of JS code that is independently executed. You can also insert a static resource into the page for use.
